website_summaries.verdict: While this play center is more simplistic than others, it's also highly adaptable for extended use.
pros: Pediatrician approved design provides a “whole body” learning experience
Customizable toy placement with 360º rotating seat that stretches for bouncing
Multi-functional design converts to a good-sized table for toddlers and older children
cons: Doesn’t offer as many features and entertainment options as others

customer_reviews.title: Beware of owl toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item to have for your baby. She loves it and loves the toys as well. The flaw is the owl toy. Her little fingers got stuck between the owl and the tree he's in. I had to pry her finger out and she got a nasty red bump on her finger. It scared her and she cried for a while. Just don't attach it to the tray until the baby's fingers are large enough not to fit in that gap.
customer_reviews.author: Newlywed88

customer_reviews.title: Careful Parents - Finger jamming hazard.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to purchase this and as an overall product it was a) easy to assemble and b) keeps my 5 month old content. HOWEVER, the owl pop up toy on the playstation is extremely dangerous for babies. My daughter got her finger stuck in the top of it simply by having her hand on top of it when she pushed down on the little tree arm. Her finger could have been broken but was only jammed. It was terrifying and definitely not something I want any other parents to have to endure. I highly recommend removing this owl, it is a safety hazard and Skip Hop should be careful with this addition.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea H.

customer_reviews.title: I liked everything else about it so I read the part ...
customer_reviews.text: I think the product description is misleading—the baby only bounces if they basically jump up and down, and the fabric seat ‘stretches.’ There are no springs and this couldn’t be considered a jumper. I liked everything else about it so I read the part of the product description that said ‘bounce,’ and convinced myself that it would be good for a baby boy who clearly wants to bounce. Otherwise it seems like a well-made product and it’s not as ugly as most activity centers. Just make sure it’s what you really want because it’s so ingeniously packaged you’ll NEVER get it back in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: My favorite baby gear
customer_reviews.text: I've been through 3 excersaucers and 1 jumperoo with 2 babies. This is my favorite. I assembled it with no tools in 5 minutes! My 6 months old loves it! It looks super cool and minimalist. I wish my house looked as good as this thing does.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Heller

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: this product is dangerous for babies. My six month old granddaughter got her finger caught in the swaying trees toy that attaches to the tray. They pull away at the bottom, which allows a baby's fingers to get caught. This is very dangerous! Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Has some flaws, but overall gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Baby seems to really enjoy it, so yay that! Dislike: - the table top/foot rest doesn't lie flush in the table (pictured). That's gonna make this a pretty crummy activity table. So thats worthless. - the foot rest is so wobbly between his feet, I wish he had something more solid he could support himself with. Maybe I'll stack some textbooks under it. Like: - he clearly enjoys the activity center. He is pretty good at staying entertained by himself and mama and his toys and the dog.. but as he's getting older (now 5.5 months) he's getting bored more and more easily. Glad to have something more in our arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: amandaf

customer_reviews.title: So Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old loves this thing. I love it because it’s not excessively stimulating. It’s simple and has some fun activities (and the piano actually has cute little tunes not obnoxious ones) but it’s not over the top. I’m of the mindset that babies don’t need all the bells and whistles and that some things are just too much and overwhelming for them, but I think this is just right. She gets some independence to practice standing on her own and rotating to different toys and she squeals and blows bubbles and yells at the cloud as she tries to get it in her mouth, it’s hilarious to watch. One of my favorite baby purchases so far for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Sara R.

customer_reviews.title: cool item baby loves it/ keyboard stopped working
customer_reviews.text: great item the baby loves to spend time in it. i wish there was a way to keep the sound on instead of turning them on every time she uses the center. Update 2/15/18: th keyboard quit working after a month of use :(
customer_reviews.author: Max V

customer_reviews.title: High five to skip hop for making this!
customer_reviews.text: Our five month old loves it! We received it yesterday and immediately put it together then placed our daughter in it and she instantly started playing with the toys. I also really like that it's not obnoxiously colored or decorated. It goes so nicely in our small home without making it look like a toy store. Thank you skip hop!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome except not working
customer_reviews.text: Everything is awesome about this except for the fact that the piano doesn’t work. Replaced batteries twice and still doesn’t turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Mina Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Not a good
customer_reviews.text: The back should be higher. If the baby leans back a bit he falls over. Not a good design
customer_reviews.author: Mo Iq

customer_reviews.title: Wow very impressed  11 out of 10.
customer_reviews.text: The only tool you need is a screwdriver and that’s to put the AAA batteries in for the piano. To set everything up is less then 10 mins and that includes wiping everything down. My daughter is 4 months old and she loves it. She does not move around in it on her own but I Am doing it with her and she loves it. Nothing makes me happier then when I see her face light up with excitement. I hope your son or daughter gets as much joy out of this as my little one does. 11 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: VERY CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: I love skip hop products for my daughter but this product was expensive but very cheap, it scratches and dents very easily..which is very disappointing. The paint will come off very easily, it collects dust just from her playing in it for a few hours one day, each play time in a day it needs to be wiped down to stay sanitary and clean, it’s very easily dirty and collects dirt and dust, which bothers me being that it’s an infant toy...also it’s very wobbly and doesn’t seem very stable, overall wish I would’ve spent my money on a better product
customer_reviews.author: Bill Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Star toy pinches
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was a very cute and sensible jumper since it can be turn into a table later on. But it has its danger. My baby is 5 months and she was playing the stars part then she started cry very hard. I found her little hand was pinched underneath of the star and it cause pain. I tried to put my finger underneath and it hurts when it pinched. I think the design was not very well and needs to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Activity Center
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one a few months ago for my baby. It has been working fine so far. It entertain my baby a lot. I honestly prefer this over a baby walker. I did my own search before buying and I can say that this is one of the best activity center. If you are planing to buy one I really suggest you to buy the Skip Hop activity center. It will help a lot the development of your baby. We allowed my baby to use it when he was around 4 months old and of course his legs were able to reach the bottom part.
customer_reviews.author: Amauris Martinez

customer_reviews.title: We love this activity center
customer_reviews.text: We love this activity center! My daughter (5mo in this pic) likes the piano and bead maze the most but pulls/twists herself around to play with all the toys. I like that it has a modern aesthetic and multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Fern Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Not for short babies
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this table. The activities are fun and keep my kid’s attention. Marking down a few stars because this item has a maximum weight limit that doesn’t really work well with the platform. We have it on the highest level, and my six month old can’t really reach the bottom. This makes it hard for them to spin, and causes them to stand on tippy toes versus flat footed. By the time they can reach it they will be almost too heavy to safely use the seat. My kid is 75th percentile for height so I imagine a lot of people will have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Clear tray traps mold
customer_reviews.text: Clear tray traps mold and dirt and cannot be removed in the model I purchased. I contacted Skip Hop directly and they said it can be returned if that is a problem. I'd say from a health standpoint that mold is definitely a health hazard. Also, pop-up toy is also a safely hazard as it traps little fingers when they grab at the owl. Since these seats are primarily used when a parent is in the same room but trying to do something like cook or do dishes and is only partially keeping and eye on the baby I'd say this safety hazard is too big to be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephka16

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, but maybe not as entertaining as others?
customer_reviews.text: It looks MUCH nicer than other activity centers - nice colors and design. That said, our son actually likes our not as attractive hand-me-down Baby Einstein activity saucer better ( I think it's because the hand-me-down one has a higher density of toys around the perimeter. Also, even though the description says that the baby can bounce in this it's not a bouncer or jumper.
customer_reviews.author: Maed

customer_reviews.title: We would have gone crazy without this
customer_reviews.text: We got this for baby as soon as he hit the age limit. We're working from home and trying to care for him during the day. He loves getting in and sitting next to us while we work. He loves to swivel around from toy to toy, and now that he's teething, he loves to put all the different pieces in his mouth. It's very easy to assemble and also to remove the seat portion for cleaning. I would advise *not* putting the batteries in because the songs are super annoying, haha. Cute, but annoying.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: We're so in love with this product and so is our little one. Love the simplicity, so easy to put together and I love the sleek look. It doesn't look like other products that are just a huge heap of plastic mess. This product has more sustainability. When I saw how the owl toy works my first thought was that it would probably pince but what is also great about this product is you can take the toys off. It's lightweight and we call it a UFO, we just love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Norton Family

customer_reviews.title: Terrific and versatile activity center!
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased this activity center for two grandsons. Both started using it as soon as they could sit up and love it. Their moms loved having them safely in a fun place while they cooked. The 19 month old doesn’t sit in his anymore but walks around playing with the toys and bringing others to the center and using it in its table form. Very versatile center. Note: The toys that suction to the surface changed a bit from 2018 to 2019 so don’t be too surprised if that happens. Both versions are great.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie J. Dulaney

customer_reviews.title: Use it every day!
customer_reviews.text: This table is awesome. We use it multiple times a day! Being able to remove the toys makes cleaning so simple. The foot pad is a little long, we had to put a pillow under it at first until our baby could reach it with her toes. It's extremely lightweight compared to other exersaucers, and does not take up much space which is handy for moving it from room to room. The seat is also machine washable and comes off/on quickly with little tabs. I feel very comfortable putting my baby in this to play independently.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Holloway

customer_reviews.title: She May Be a Little Spoiled!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter. I was skeptical because it was about double what I wanted to spend. I bought it because it turns into a table ad she grows older. I though that dynamic would help justify the cost. Instead, I found this is something that she absolutely loves. As you can tell by the video, she changes activities frequently. I wouldn’t hesitate to purchase this as gifts for my family and friends..it is THAT good. Don’t the the expense scare you away. It entertains her several times a day for a good chunk of time.
customer_reviews.author: Mom45750

customer_reviews.title: Very happy baby. Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect product for your baby. We are so happy with buying this product. It gives us some time to do things around the house while the little one is clearly having fun. I was worried that he will get bored of it quickly (since it’s kinda pricey) but he loves it. I wonder if he will still like it when he will grow older but even if it will benefit us during this year I think it is totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: A.L.

customer_reviews.title: This product is great
customer_reviews.text: We bought for my nephew even though at the time he was too young for it. Never realized how quickly he could actually use it. They began putting him it in as soon as he could support himself, and he absolutely LOVES it. As he grew he was able to strengthen his legs by pushing up off the footboard without them worrying about him falling over. He's 6 months old now and they've already taken it up a notch and he can reach all the attached toys now. He will stay in it and play for a long time without getting fussy. His mother is happy :)
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST BABY ITEM I HAVE BOUGHT
customer_reviews.text: I'm obsessed with this baby item. Here are a couple reasons why: 1) It is developmentally appropriate 2) It's easy to put together, and take apart ( because trust me you'll want to take this everywhere) 3) Baby LOVES it, she screams and giggles when I put her in it 4)It is easy to clean 5) It has multiple uses, when baby grows out of it, simple convert it to a table and buy the little chair that skip hop also makes. 6) It's also so cute and not as obnoxious as those other looking jumper things
customer_reviews.author: fatima

customer_reviews.title: 8 month old heaven
customer_reviews.text: Life saver for us with a very busy, crawling 8 month old baby. He loves all the toys and loves to spin around and jump up and down in it. So easy to assemble. Feels like good quality! The only thing I worry about is that when he’s on the ground nearby he tries to pull himself up and a few times it has started to tip over and I’m afraid it might land on him. But otherwise I think this thing is genius. I would suggest to anyone who needs a little baby zone that isn’t the floor!
customer_reviews.author: YOGA LADY

customer_reviews.title: Best one of it's kind!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy! Most importantly my baby loves this toy! The toys are easy to apply and remove and can be placed anywhere you choose. Which I love. The toys are very bending and very kid friendly. A couple of cons. The bowl will not stay on for nothing. The piano will not click into the top, which is annoying because if baby plays with it it keeps falling off and baby gets mad and I have to keep picking it up. Also, there were parts of the assembly that was a little tough. Overall it is still definitely worth it and I would 100% reccommend this to anyone and everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these chairs once my daughter was ready to use the table that goes with them.... love how it could convert to a table for older kids. The chairs are nice and simple, easy to wipe clean and super sturdy. They have rubber bottoms so they don't slide easily. My one year old can stand next to them and hold on and they don't tip. They are also comfortable for my 3 year old. However they are a little small, I don't know how long they will last. I can't see my kids using them once past age 5.
customer_reviews.author: AlyVonD

customer_reviews.title: Major flaw...
customer_reviews.text: Great for babies - keeps them entertained and stimulated! My son wants to be held 24/7, so it’s nice to get a break with this activity gym. I’m giving this 3 stars because it has a major flaw... the clear discovery window piece isn’t removable. There are crevices that you cannot get to with a wipe or paper towel. My son slobbers and spits up, and it gets trapped under the discovery window. This is unsanitary and leaves the activity gym prone to bacteria and mold!
customer_reviews.author: BFit2day

customer_reviews.title: Alot of fun..easy for them to spin around
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved it!!! She's loving all the toys not too busy where she doesn't know what to play with but enough entertainment to keep her happy. My only issue with is is that one of the toys kept pinching her little fingers ( the tree looking things) because she was trying to pull it out of the base and since it's on aelastic it's going back and hurting her ...she figured out how to get her finger out but she cried and wanted to get out. Love that this turns into a table because they grow out of the sitting in part so quick.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. I searched and searched for the most affordable, functional and neutral jumper for our little guy and this one was it! We have a small space and it is easy to keep out of the way. He has been in it since four month and loves it. Love that he has room to grow in it and when he finally does out grow it it can turn into a table! Great purchase! I highly recommend! Oh and I absolutely love Skip Hop. For some reason I didn’t even realize they made it until I looked at him playing in it one day lol
customer_reviews.author: Ramirez Family Buys

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable seating.
customer_reviews.text: My baby did not like this thing at all. The seat seemed uncomfortable for her; it made her to kind of lean to the front and her back was arched. As soon as we put her in it, she started to be irritated, even toys did not grab her attention. Sadly, it did not work for us, we had to go with another product.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: MISSING PIECES
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and it came without the freaking seat! what am I supposed to do with an activity center that doesn't have a seat for my baby to sit in!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Son starting to become interested at 5 months
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent kids toy. Son doesnt find to much interest in it. Hopefully he will like it when he can use the table and chairs as a toddler. Not the easiest thing to move between rooms. Sure you can click it apart but who wants to do that every time ya need to move it. If ya have narrow doorways keep this in mind. Wished hed loved it. Unfortunately not a win for this mama, but every kid is different. Update- moving to 4 stars because hes starting to find some interest! Kids toys are coming a long ways keep it up!
customer_reviews.author: Vintage Gypsy Decor

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if your baby puts the toys in the mouth
customer_reviews.text: Great item to keep the baby entertained. But be CAREFUL with the rainbow (the arching piece over the sun) if your baby tries to put the tube in the month as mine does. She would grab the tube inward, put it in her mouth and loose her hands. The tube will spring back and hurt her mouth. We had to eventually remove that piece. She does the same thing to the lamb, yet the lamb is bulkier and she needs her hands to keep it in place. With the tube, she easily let it go and that's where the potential danger arises.
customer_reviews.author: Chen

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these chairs!
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are great! Very sturdy and easy for my 18 month old to sit in. She loves sitting at her table now and uses it to do all sorts of things. I like that they are not too tall so when she inevitably decides to stand on it, she can’t get too far. They are very sturdy and tuck under the table if you’re trying to save some space when they aren’t being used. So happy they come in packs of two! As they are plastic they are super easy to clean, keep in mind they are white chairs so you’re going to see everything on them right away but again they are super easy to wipe down!
customer_reviews.author: Simi G.

customer_reviews.title: Toys are good, bowl is not.
customer_reviews.text: Only “bad” thing is the bowl does not stay attached, it’s just a suction cup and doesn’t clip in place like the toys. Sooo if you were to use it to hold little treats when baby gets older you will have a mess. We just put a orb ball in there. This keeps baby entertained for a little while. She enjoys the toys. At first she was unsure of the base she stands on but after a couple weeks she’s gotten the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 month old loves it. She is developmentally ahead and is really into assisted standing, so this is perfect for her. We are so thankful we have this for a quick set down to wash a dish or put something away in sight. I liked this one better than the regular one because I heard of kids getting their fingers stuck in the owl that pops up and down. This model has the toy with two clouds instead which solves the problem completely. We still keep floor time the main event, though! :)
customer_reviews.author: Drew Chatterton

customer_reviews.title: So glad it found it !!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves this standing play gym!! It’s her favorite of everyday , all day!! She plays with all the toys on it & it has 4 height adjustments! I don’t usually write reviews but bc it has helped me get things done, I am letting moms know you NEED this!!! My daughter will easily play on this for an hour at a time a few times a day! We wake up & this is the first thing I put her on along with her favorite show puppy dog pals ! She was 4 months when I got it & 6 months now!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Arechiga

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Comfortable after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just because these are the perfect height for sitting at our coffee table, but these little chairs are a huge hit in my house with kids aged 5/7/9. Plus my 180 lb butt sits comfortably on the chairs and we've had them for almost a year and a half. They also don't take up a lot of space so they fit nicely under our coffee table when we aren't sitting in them. We use them multiple times a day, including homework time, so it's easy to sit in them for long periods. Just bought a second pair so that the kids won't fight over who gets to use them.
customer_reviews.author: John and Ava St John

customer_reviews.title: Great little chairs.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant on buying these because they had no backs and I was worried about my 2 year old granddaughter sitting safely in them. No need to worry. She sits right down in them and gets right to coloring! They are light enough that she can move them, but they are study enough that they stay put and upright. Went together one, two, three. They are a perfect height for her and the table they are designed for. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but too tall
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old son is VERY tall for his age (99th%) and his feet were inches from the ground. He couldn't get up on the chair unassisted and tumbled over several times before I re-boxed and returned. The low back isn't a big deal if you realize how low it is. It is more like a stool than a chair. I really wish the legs were adjustable or just shorter so we could keep them. They're very nice but we need something that can work now, not in another 6-12 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun activities for our little one.
customer_reviews.text: We looked through many bouncers for our child before settling on the skip hop. A lot of the harness-based bouncers were a bit too gaudy and overstimulating for our senses (and we assumed for our child's as well). There is a calmness with this Skip Hop activity center's simplicity. 5 toys, very warm pastel colors. A piano. The only gripe about the piano is that the LED lights are a bit too bright. We had a defective piano that wouldn't click in. We got a replacement and it worked well. We haven't tried out the table functionality yet, but it looks like that'll work out well when our child grows older.
customer_reviews.author: Luan M. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Wish it could be adjusted a bit more !
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this play table however I do wish that the foot stand could be adjusted to a little shorter setting. I have a 4 month old who is in the 55th percentile for height and he can't comfortable reach the foot stand. The suggested age for this table is 4mo. Other than that, he seems to be interested in everything going on around him when he's playing with this table.
customer_reviews.author: Foreverjaded

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, but still great for the baby
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for jumping seats for the baby and kept running in to this. I liked it because of its versatility; however, i also thought the foot board straps were like bungy cords to allow the baby to bounce it. Unfortunately, it turns out they are straps so the board only sways. Overall though, it's still a great toy and the baby loves it. Plenty to play with around the top and the swivel seat allows them to turn around. It was simple to put together without instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised - Beware!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product had been opened and parts were not the ones that were originally in package. Came with two piano and two lambs versus all the different parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I wish I got when I had my first. I got this because I’m so tired of buying things my little ones use for a few months then you either toss donate, or sell. I love how with this you can use for different stages and it’s very durable. My little one grabs and yanks on the the attachment and none of broke. The rainbow piece has been bent, pulled grabbed and still remains in one piece and always goes right back to the upright position. It’s even held up against my 4 year old. I have to say money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: amanda BSB

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We received these chairs yesterday and I am already so happy we bought them. We have a small kids activity table (not Skip Hop brand) but these chairs work great with them. They were so easy to put together, will be easy to maintain and seem very durable and sturdy. I love that the legs have little rubber pieces on the ends that keep the chairs from slipping. My 22 month old has no problem getting in and out of them and loves moving them all over the house and sitting in them! Would absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Power

customer_reviews.title: Nice, matching, sturdy chairs
customer_reviews.text: These were a great addition to the table we purchased earlier when our daughter used it as an activity center. Now that she’s almost 2 we decided to use it as a table and needed chairs. She’s a bit on the short side so getting in and out of them can be a feat. She’ll grow into them. I wish they were with adjustable legs like the table is. My husband has set in one at my daughters request and it didn’t budge, but I wouldn’t recommend making a habit of it
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old son has loved playing in this toy for months. We bought it probably 4-5 months ago. We haven’t had any problems with his fingers getting jammed like other parents have experienced. We saw some reviews that referred to it as the “poop machine”. This is TRUTH!! If he hasn’t pooped in a day or two, stick him in this thing, bam! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Rich

customer_reviews.title: Grows with Baby
customer_reviews.text: I’m a former early childhood teacher and can confidently say this is my favorite play table. The bottom is adjustable, the activities aren’t too far away from little hands, even young ones, and it does exactly what it says. It goes from baby being inside, to access to activities as they learn to walk to table top. Our little one used it as a great incentive to pull up and play while learning to stand. My daughter is one now and we use it as a coloring table. This is a must have for new parents.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Great activity center
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves it now that he is 5.5 months. The only thing I would add just to be extra safe would be some sort of straps on the seat. Babies don't have full control of their bodies even when they have full head control so it would be a nice precaution for them not to bump their heads when they lean forward and their bodies win.
customer_reviews.author: Mafer

customer_reviews.title: Lots to do
customer_reviews.text: I just took it out of the box and assembled. I’ll update this review once I’ve seen it in action more. So far, assembly was fairly easy. I wish the foot support could come up a little higher as my little one has short legs. The seat is a little too flimsy in my opinion. Would like some padding. I can’t figure out what the loops on the seat are for yet. I love that it turns 360 degrees. She loves the piano. It plays sounds by touch, songs, or just by music. The piano alone is worth some money. I also love that it grows with your kid.
customer_reviews.author: TeacherTonya

customer_reviews.title: My 5 month old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! My son would spend all day in here if he could. Very sturdy and grows with your child. We started putting him in here at just over 3 months (he had good neck/head control) and we put a blanket behind him to keep him from wobbling around too much. He is now just over five months and loves looking around and standing upright in it! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Megan F.

customer_reviews.title: Skip Hop is the 2020 version of a jumper
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stationary baby play area!!! My son loves it — 8 months. The developmental attachments are fun. Wish the sold other attachments to switch out when he gets bored. Love the mobile platform. The music is hip hop so not annoying baby high pitch tunes.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Best toy for infant
customer_reviews.text: If you're unsure about splurging like I was, just so yourself an enormous favor and take the plunge. My child's pediatrician brought up the dangers posed by walkers and in doing my own research they can actually slow down baby's progress to walking. My son has enjoyed this toy every day since he was 4 months old. He is now six months and I feel it has helped him develop his leg muscles plus he engages with the toys with the same enthusiasm as day 1 which is super helpful to allow you to get a breather from a demanding infant or get a quick chore done as well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JoannaOliv

customer_reviews.title: Looks great...
customer_reviews.text: Great idea...piano doesn't work (batteries last about 20 minutes in it, cloud toy broke, owl is dangerous...The legs themselves need to be adjusted with each use. Baby loves it and it looks great though...
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Box so damaged don't know if I want to take a chance
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a Christmas gift for my daughter/granddaughter, but the box looks like it went through the mill (all banged up and ripped on one side). I took a peak inside and it appears it might be ok, but I won't know until she opens it on Christmas - too late then! It also makes for an ugly gift that won't be easy to wrap. Don't know what to do at this point.
customer_reviews.author: D Shockency

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I got this yesterday since we first bought the skip hop table and now need the chairs. I really like how sturdy these chairs are and how easy they are to assemble. Just snap the legs to the seat and you’re done. The feet have rubber in them so they dont slip or slide even on shiny surfaces. My kid wants to stand before sitting and this does not budge at all. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C.

customer_reviews.title: favorite play station
customer_reviews.text: Our baby is currently 5 months old and we've been using this since around 3.5 months. Its been fun seeing her get more and more alert and actually play with the toys (attachments) on this activity center. Everything can be wiped down as its all plastic. The seat is fabric - can be removed and machine washed, I normally air dry it afterwards. Washed it a couple times already without any problems. Would recommend it to all
customer_reviews.author: min2be

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous activity center for the young baby with good neck control.
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this activity center! I would give it 5 stars if we didn’t already have a bouncer. They both get used regularly. He does seem to prefer the bouncer rather than this. However, he has loved this since around 3.5 months when he had great head and neck control already. I wouldn’t have put him in the bouncer that young just yet because he was too wobbly. This is a great because of all the lights and sheep. He loves to play in it still. But tries to bounce with little success. 🤣
customer_reviews.author: Candice Maxim

customer_reviews.title: Worth the little extra.
customer_reviews.text: First off , our baby loves it. Its well built and has a good variety of toys to play with and interact. It was easy to set up and easy enough that we take it places so the baby can continue to play with it. The food bowl is a great touch. In another month or two we will convert it to the table and the kids will keep playing with it. We havent had any concerns while moving it that it will become less sturdy over time or break.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lamborn

customer_reviews.title: Great! But cut my little ones tounge.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my five month old and he very much enjoys it. He is 7 months now and it’s held up well. The cover does well in the washing machine. It can be wiped and taken apart for travel well. My only complaint is that the cloud toy somehow I have NO CLUE how cut my little ones mouth. There was blood and a minor cut on his tounge. It defiantly was the toy because I was watching him play with it, as it was his favorite and he scared painfully crying because of the cut. Such a freak accident. I’ve removed it and he now still enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great match for skiphop table. Wait for a sale.
customer_reviews.text: Nice match for the skip hop activity table. Some of the legs were difficult to snap in for some reason. My daughter is almost 2 and slightly taller than average. She goes up on her toes and leans forward, holding onto the table to get her but up on the seat. Its a little high but I'd rather that than too low and outgrow too quickly. She doesn't have a problem with the low back. I got them while they were on sale, as I don't think they're worth the normal $40 pricetag.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney W

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This has been perfect for our son since 3.5 months and still going strong at 10 months. It's great to have him contained and entertained if I'm, say, making dinner and don't want him crawling around. It has also really given him strong legs! He's just starting to pull himself up on the outside of it and I'm sure will play with it that way & then as a table for quite some time! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: A.G.S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old loves her activity gym. It is fun to see her look through the window down to the piano at her feet while she stomps and plays music! Tons of giggles that are contagious for sure! Really cute theme as well and really easy to clean. Was very easy to assemble, had it up in about half an hour while distracted by my curious toddlers. It is sturdy as well, with all her bouncing around the gym hardly shakes side to side. Definitely a favorite buy of mine!
customer_reviews.author: Serina

customer_reviews.title: Great seats for the skip hop table
customer_reviews.text: Wish I bought these sooner to go with the skip hop jumper/table I got at my baby shower. Got them last night and immediately assembled. They are a lifesaver for me while I work from home and watch my daughter during this pandemic. My daughter loves sitting in them and having her stuffed animals and dolls sit on them as well. She will sit at the table for hours having tea parties with her animals all while I can work. They are great and super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and Happy with Purchase But 4 Months a Little Too Young for This
customer_reviews.text: Toys and table are very well made and very glad I bought it. Sturdy and legs are set wide enough so that it won't tip over. The only reason I gave 4 stars is the Ages given for the item. It says 4 mos and I thinks that is too young. My 6 month old granddaughter still has a little trouble balancing in the seat and manipulating the toys so it only keeps her interest for 5 minutes or so. Maybe another month or 2 she will be ready.
customer_reviews.author: cleosmom

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic, Worth every Dollar
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest thing ever for a baby!!!! Is versatile, fun and soooo needed for all moms out there. The design is absolutely genius, very well thought and put together. The toys are entertaining and interesting for my baby and the piano makes sound at the vibration of him moving. Easy to clean and wash. Decently light to move around. I cannot stress enough how worth my money this was.
customer_reviews.author: Nolly

customer_reviews.title: Little guy loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this activity center because I liked that it didn't look like it would be a big bulky eye sore in the living room. It definitely met that requirement for me. I also liked that it could be used as a standing activity center (when he grows into that) and also a table with chairs after that (again when he grows into that). The little guy really does love playing in this activity center. Its a nice place to be able to entertain him while I wash dishes or fold laundry. I would recommend this to anyone looking for this type of item.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great activity center for city living
customer_reviews.text: I live in a busy city neighborhood in an apartment and wanted something for my son to play in. He started to show signs of wanting to sit up and I wanted something to put him in to encourage being 'upright' while also allowing him to play. Its also a great break from holding him all the time! This design is great because its compact for a small apartment. I also like the colors, mostly white so its not too busy and matches our modern aesthetic. He loves it and has now been using it for 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Ferdinand Ferrao III

customer_reviews.title: Super cute!
customer_reviews.text: This is even better than we had hoped! Once I got it and posted a video online, several of my mommy friends commented they had this one and thought it was awesome too! Even after a few months of play, my 8 mo old still loves the toys on it. They are moveable too so we had to add some of our own toys to the tray too.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlei

customer_reviews.title: Cutest jumper by far!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE how cute this seat is! It doesnt stick out as much as other baby seats! All the toys are super adorable and engaging for the little one! So easy to assemble, just snap a few things in place, no tools! It came very well packaged. My little guy LOVES it and I love that the foot platform is adjustable and removable! You could easily remove the legs and toss this in the car for a vacation trip or just to make for easier storage! I can't wait to buy the chairs and use it as a table for my 2 yr old and baby boy!
customer_reviews.author: Alijoann18

customer_reviews.title: Love this play seat
customer_reviews.text: My grand-daughter loves this seat . It is adjustable, versatile, and colorful. The attachments are moveable which has been wonderful as she continues to grow. The seat swivels. This allows for baby to choose directions and adds strength as she uses the attachments for leverage. It is very stable and not too heavy to move around the room. I am so glad that we made this purchase. By far the best adjustable and moveable baby play station.
customer_reviews.author: Peg

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 month baby... she likes it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 3.5 months and she didn’t reach the bottom nor can sit up straight by herself. She doesn’t get fussy with it when I put a blanket for support around her seat. I also added another blanket for her to reach the bottom. She already try’s to play with the toys and loves the piano. For now she only uses it for 10 mins or so before she gets fussy since she can’t use all the toys by herself. I’m sure she will enjoy it more soon. It was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth flores

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect activity center in my opinion. I love the color scheme SO much better than the other centers that are a riot of color and a bit overcrowded with toys. I love that you can move each toy to whichever position you’d like, or you can just take it off completely. And my 6 month old loves it as well! The toys are interactive without being obnoxious. Even the electronic piano plays much better music than other brands. Yay! My son takes time to explore each item in turn, and especially loves to smash down that rattling cloud. I would highly recommend this product to anyone with a baby.
customer_reviews.author: RVR

customer_reviews.title: My twins fight over it!
customer_reviews.text: We got one of these (and another jumper type thing) for our twins and they love this one the best! It has so many activities and has already grown with them as they've gotten taller and better at playing with things. They love all the different toys attached and love that it will become a table later one so we don't have to just get rid of it. Really well made, as most things from this company are. Looks really good with our decor too!
customer_reviews.author: Lovethefall123

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like it more but still good
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I'm raving about this product- my 2 gripes are the fact that they don't offer more toys you can stick on and interchange and the fact that the piano only attaches to the foot part. I wish you could attach the piano to the table itself as my baby is really curious about it but can't push it with his feet, so either have to press the buttons or it's useless. I wish you could interchange where it's positioned
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Grows with baby
customer_reviews.text: Perfect perfect perfect! Started putting my baby in this when she was 4 months old. She’s seven months now and LOVES playing in this. Her siblings can interact with her which makes it that much better!
customer_reviews.author: Tarrence Simmons

customer_reviews.title: My 4 month old loves his new toy
customer_reviews.text: What a neat idea to be able to turn this into a table! I love anything that can be altered to prolong it's use because it feels like you buy a bunch of baby stuff just to get rid of it in a couple of months. Very sturdy and love that it's made of non toxic plastic. Skip hop is one of my favorite children's brands due to there constantly high quality products. Will definitely be buying the matching chairs in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: CountryMama777

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to put together. However I purchased this for when my grandson comes. Purchased it because my daughter had one. Well when I put it all together never received same toys as hers. In fact she had five, I had three. Two of the same toy. Very disappointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for baby.
customer_reviews.text: Our baby boy loves this activity center. We always want to buy baby products that are good quality and grow with the baby; we did our research and found this one, it was pricey but we decided to buy it. We had to wait because it was out of stock for a while but it was worth the wait and the price. It's made of a good quality material, easy to assemble, neutral colors and not overstimulating for baby. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: O. Nom

customer_reviews.title: Great baby activity seat that turns into table.
customer_reviews.text: Really great for baby. Easily sets up, took less then ten minutes. Fairly sturdy but lightweight so it’s easy to move room to room, very easily adjusts height. Love that it’s so easy to clean. The only thing that I don’t like is that it really isn’t a bouncy or jumper- the seat has fabric that is supposed to be stretchy but it’s not very functional for a jumpy seat. But overall it’s a great entertaining seat for baby. Glad we got this one. Also love that it transitions to a table too!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: grows with Child stages
customer_reviews.text: this was Perfect for my four month old daughter. It was easy to put together, all snaps and my daughter likes that there's room to Sit forward and back Without Hitting her face on any of the toys. the only thing I wish was on there was educational toys. but my favorite Part is that it Will grow With her. it turns into a table. It also comes With a small bowl.
customer_reviews.author: jacoches808

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are not what I was hoping they'd be. Toddler can easily fall backwards.. poor design in my opinion. Seems like child better find his/her core balance to stay seated .. just an awkward chair. I purchased the activity table years ago and love it.. these seats match that table so I gave it a try...and not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: IT IS WORTH THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES this! I debated buying this for a couple weeks because it seemed a little overpriced but it is WELL WORTH the money and I hate that she didn’t have it sooner! She is 4 months and her length for it is perfect! Its also a cute addition to her room and has a clean look to it, unlike a lot of the other bulky, bright colored activity centers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing purchase
customer_reviews.text: This activity center is worth every penny! It was so easy to put together. No tools required, everything just clicked together. The cloth seat comes off easily to throw in the washing machine. However the table requires a little more work to clean. The extra toys that it comes with can easily be moved and rearranged. I love that the standing board will fit on top of the table to create a standard table when my son is old enough for that. It is something that will work for him as he grows, which makes the price more reasonable. Overall this is a great product and a necessity for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Tinkler .edu

customer_reviews.title: Cute, fun, and functional
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old loves it. We got it a few months ago and had a piece break almost immediately. I emailed Skip Hop and was pleasantly surprised to get the replacement piece very quickly with no hassle. Customer service was fantastic. The activity center is cute, doesn’t make obnoxious noises or play annoying songs time after time (like our previous one), and it’s easy to clean. I’d recommend this one over some of the larger more traditional ones without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Niece

customer_reviews.title: Best modern day mom exersaucer
customer_reviews.text: It may be just me but I was going crazy over how there aren't any esthetically pretty exersaucers or activity centers. This was the most neutral one I could find. My 6 month old loves it and can just now turn herself around in it. Highly recommend- especially for the mom who can't stand to have a gaudy multi colored plastic eye sore in her living room 😂
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Lybeck

customer_reviews.title: It's been fun to watch him become interested in the different things ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because 9 out of 10 babies I know have this table. My son LOVES hanging out in it, it's been our go-to place to set him down for a quick minute or for extended play for the past 5 months now. It's been fun to watch him become interested in the different things as he continues to develop. 1 small quibble is that I wish the bowl would stick to the trey a bit better - the kid pries it up and tosses it over the edge in no time flat.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is only 3 months but she loves this activity center!! There is some give in the seat so that she can bounce herself. The footrest aides in helping her work on her balance. The toys are entertaining for both her and I. She can swivel 360 degrees too! I love the look and size of this. It does not take up much room and it is not obnoxious looking like a majority of children's toys. I would absolutely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Taryn FieldingTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Nice colors and fun for baby!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m very pleased with my purchase. I bought specifically because it didn’t have all the gaudy colors and not too many electronics. I hate toys that are like fireworks exploding in babies face, but still engaging and interesting enough to keep baby occupied. My baby loves to stand right now and this is perfect for that, and I love that it turns into a table later. My only complaint is that they imply it’s a jumper too (description says sit, swivel, bounce, and play) and it is definitely not meant for jumping/bouncing.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son when he was 4 months old. I was hesitant about the price at the time but if I had known how much we would use it, I probably would have paid even more for it. My son is 7 months now and we use this for atleast 1.5-2 hours combined daily. He hasn’t grown tired of it at all. We also purchased several suction cup toys so that the toys can be rotated out and replaced for variety. This product is worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: amanda st. amour

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES this activity center. Truly loves it. It’s easy to assemble, easy to clean, and the fabric liner comes off and is machine washable (which I’ve done several times since buying) and still looks brand new! I’ve bought some additional toys for it as well just to give her more variety but the ones it comes with are great. 10/10 recommend. I went back and forth between this one and a cheaper option and I’m glad I spent the extra 20 or 30 bucks and got this one
customer_reviews.author: Shannon P

customer_reviews.title: Craftsmanship a bit lacking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this table because I liked how it coverts to a table for when the child is older. However the grey table top insert is very difficult to "click in". I could not do it by myself. Someone had to really bang it in there. And like other people have mentioned, it does not lie flush with the table. Clicking the seat in and out is not that easy either, but theortically, you'd only need to do this once over the product's lifetime so that's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: TryingItOut

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: For us worked out from 7th month. Now he is 8 month old, better in standing, able to turn around himself, destroying the piano (turn out very sturdy - survived lot of falls on stone floor, still as new). Love the forest, cloud and the “poop in the log” how my husband calls the owl.
customer_reviews.author: Ajna Kenning

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had our Skip Hop gymn for about a year now and have loved it since day one. The removable balance board helped with his motor skill development and he quickly caught on to spinning around to reach his favorite toys. We’ve now converted it to the play table and he loves to driving his cars on and ‘dj’ sessions at the keyboard. Looking forward to getting the chairs when he is a little older. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: HSell14

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond obsessed with these chairs! They’re neutral and just so great for toddlers I paired it with an amazon coffee table for my kids playroom and it’s so cute
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

product_meta.title: Skip Hop Baby Activity Center: Interactive Play Center with 3-Stage Grow-with-Me Functionality, 4mo+, Explore & More
product_meta.description: Our modern activity center captivates baby from head-to- toe-from four months to toddler! Designed in collaboration with a pediatrician, our baby activity center supports a "whole body" approach to play and learning. Easy to assemble, with toys that can be positioned anywhere for baby, it features a 360-degree rotating seat that turns and stretches for bouncing. Our unique Discovery Window lets baby see their feet while they play to learn cause and effect. As baby grows, our activity center converts for easy cruising-ultimately becoming a clean, sturdy table for coloring, playing and more. A modern, clean aesthetic and multiple uses will make this activity center a family favorite! Features: Ages 4m+ Three stages of use: Sit, swivel, bounce & play; Cruise & interact; Play table 25+ developmental activities Discovery Window lets baby see piano and their feet while playing Clip-on toys can be positioned based on baby's abilities Converts to a play table with a smooth, seamless surface 360-degree rotating seat that stretches for bouncing and includes toy loops to attach toys Musical, light-up piano with three ways to play: piano mode, song mode and motion sensor mode Peek-a-boo owl pops out and hoots Spring cloud with colorful beads Swaying trees move back and forth Hedgehog bead chaser with spinner Includes suction bee snack bowl; dishwasher-safe Foot support platform adjusts to the perfect height Legs detach for easy storage Phthalate-free Size (inches): 31l x 31w x 18.5h; (cm): 79l x 79w x 47h. Clean with dry cloth only.
feature_bullets: Designed In Collaboration With A Pediatrician, Our Modern Baby Activity Center Captivates Baby From Head-to-toe And Provides A "Whole Body" Approach To Play From Four Months To Toddler

Four Movable Toys Include: Peekaboo Clouds That Pop Up And Squeak, Wobble Lamb With Rattle Beads, Swaying Stars Move Back And Forth And Sun Bead Mover With Spinner. Totals to over 25 Developmental Activities.
Features 360-Degree Rotating Seat & Unique Discovery Window That Lets Baby See Piano And Their Feet While Playing To Learn Cause And Effect Through Hearing And Spatial Awareness

As Baby Grows, Activity Center Converts from Bouncer To Sturdy Table For Easy Cruising For Coloring, Playing & More. A Modern, Clean Aesthetic And Multiple Uses Will Make This Activity Center A Family Favorite
Do Not Use With Children Over 25 Pounds Or Over 30 Inches. For Use Only With Infant Who Can Hold Up Their Headrest Unaided. For Ages 4M+

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,701 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
